item.title: Report E-2024090369
item.description:
Report E-2024090369

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-19T09:21:33+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-06
  • City: WILMINGTON
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On September 6, 2024, one (1) 5-gallon pail of Swisher Hercules was punctured and released approximately one (1) gallon of product to the dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from First Call Environmental (FCE) to remediate the impacted site. FCE personnel deployed granular absorbents to the Swisher Hercules-impacted dock floor and swept them in with hand tools. Crews neutralized the absorbents and spilled materials and utilized pH test strips. All spent absorbents were collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum, and one (1) damaged pail of Swisher Hercules was collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum.

item.title: Report E-2024090363
item.description:
Report E-2024090363

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-19T09:21:33+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-23
  • City: COLUMBUS
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 0416 ET, XPO notified ERTS of a cargo release at terminal BCO. It was reported that approximately 1 cup of 960BK177 DO HAP33 Liner Black was released from a 55-gallon DM due to a forklift puncture. The release impacted trailer #3172891. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the caller and felt comfortable cleaning up the release with PPE available on-site. The damaged drum and cleanup debris were containerized in in 65-gallon poly drum which was staged on site for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report E-2024090354
item.description:
Report E-2024090354

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-19T09:21:33+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-22
  • City: CINCINNATI
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 16:15 PM ET, XCN contacted ERTS to report a spill that occurred inside trailer in West Chester, OH. The spill consists of approximately half a gallon of Surfink Bag Color, which was released from 1–55-gallon metal drum due to a forklift puncture by the shipper when they loaded the container onto the trailer. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the terminal. Terminal cleaned the spill with absorbents and placed the contents into a 65-gallon metal drum with plastic lining. The waste was staged on site for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report E-2024080745
item.description:
Report E-2024080745

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-18T09:15:04+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-22
  • City: WALBRIDGE
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: CSX TRANSPORTATION, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On 8/22/2024, at 1353 hours, CSXT personnel at the Walbridge Yard discovered FHRX135943, a loaded tank car of Sulfur, Molten, with a vapor release from the connection between the manway nozzle and the manway cover. The car was isolated and the shipper, Marathon Petroleum Company, was notified via CHEMTREC (Report #2024082200196). CSXT Hazardous Materials Manager Scott Karcher found the manway gasket to be improperly installed (misaligned) which allowed for a vapor release. The damaged gasket was removed, a new gasket was installed, and the manway was secured for transportation. The issue was identified and corrective actions were communicated to the shipper’s representative (Jennifer Johnson 209-986-1196). This incident did require a special switching move. 7.1 is not required.

item.title: Report E-2024090218
item.description:
Report E-2024090218

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-15T09:12:56+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-03
  • City: WILMINGTON
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On September 3, 2024, one (1) 5-gallon pail of UN3266 was crushed in transit and released approximately three (3) gallons of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Thin Line Environmental (TLE) to remediate the impacted site. TLE personnel discovered that one (1) 5-gallon pail of UN3266 washer fluid and one (1) 5-gallon pail of non-regulated washer fluid were damaged and released approximately three (3) gallons of product. TLE personnel utilized hand tools, absorbents, and soda ash to remediate the sulfuric acid-impacted impacted dock floor. The damaged pail and all impacted debris were collected and containerized into three (3) 55-gallon drums

item.title: Report E-2024090216
item.description:
Report E-2024090216

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-15T09:12:56+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-30
  • City: COLUMBIANA
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 4000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On August 30, 2024, one (1) 330-gallon tote of UN3098 arrived with a faulty cap and released approximately less than 0.03 gallons (<0.03) to the top of the tote, which evaporated before crews arrived. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from EnviroServe (ES) to remediate the impacted site. ES personnel replaced the faulty cap and staged the tote on site for continued processing and shipping by the facility. A cotton rag was used to remove free standing dirt and debris from the trailer floor and possession of the rag was retained by R+L.
